intro: Scabiosa leucactis, commonly known as the white scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often branched. Scabiosa leucactis is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
